verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:1
verses.text: Be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:2
verses.text: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered them to you.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:3
verses.text: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:4
verses.text: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonoureth his head.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:5
verses.text: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:6
verses.text: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:7
verses.text: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:8
verses.text: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:9
verses.text: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:10
verses.text: For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:11
verses.text: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:12
verses.text: For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of God.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:13
verses.text: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:14
verses.text: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:15
verses.text: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given her for a covering.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:16
verses.text: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:17
verses.text: Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:18
verses.text: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:19
verses.text: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:20
verses.text: When ye come together therefore into one place, this is not to eat the Lord’s supper.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:21
verses.text: For in eating every one taketh before other his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:22
verses.text: What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:23
verses.text: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:24
verses.text: And when he had given thanks, he brake it, and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:25
verses.text: After the same manner also he took the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink it, in remembrance of me.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:26
verses.text: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord’s death till he come.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:27
verses.text: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink this cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:28
verses.text: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of that cup.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:29
verses.text: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:30
verses.text: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:31
verses.text: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:32
verses.text: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:33
verses.text: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

verses.name: 1 Corinthians 11:34
verses.text: And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
